---
title: "Data Acquisition"
author: "Julius von Sulecki"
---


# Data Acquisition

Data for analysation can be imported in different ways. One way is to read data from csv or excel sheets, another is to import it directly from databases.


::: {.cell hash='02_data_acquisition_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_57f77dafecc1d58e3c2014bfd2b7a7fc'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(RSQLite)
con <- RSQLite::dbConnect(drv = SQLite(), dbname = "../../00_data/02_chinook/Chinook_Sqlite.sqlite") #connect to database

library(DBI) #to print the tables print(dbListTables(con))

library(dplyr) 
print(tbl(con, "Album")) #to examine table from database
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> # Source:   table<Album> [?? x 3]
#> # Database: sqlite 3.41.2 [D:\Git\ss23-bdsb-juliusace9000\00_data\02_chinook\Chinook_Sqlite.sqlite]
#>    AlbumId Title                                 ArtistId
#>      <int> <chr>                                    <int>
#>  1       1 For Those About To Rock We Salute You        1
#>  2       2 Balls to the Wall                            2
#>  3       3 Restless and Wild                            2
#>  4       4 Let There Be Rock                            1
#>  5       5 Big Ones                                     3
#>  6       6 Jagged Little Pill                           4
#>  7       7 Facelift                                     5
#>  8       8 Warner 25 Anos                               6
#>  9       9 Plays Metallica By Four Cellos               7
#> 10      10 Audioslave                                   8
#> # i more rows
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
album_tbl <- tbl(con, "Album") %>% collect() #pull data in local memory

dbDisconnect(con) #disconnect database
```
:::


# API


::: {.cell hash='02_data_acquisition_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_7d96544a827392a071e5dfcb4c32677d'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(glue)
name <- "Fred"
glue('My name is {name}.')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> My name is Fred.
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(httr)
resp <- GET("https://swapi.dev/api/people/1/")

# Wrapped into a function
sw_api <- function(path) {
  url <- modify_url(url = "https://swapi.dev", path = glue("/api{path}"))
  resp <- GET(url)
  stop_for_status(resp) # automatically throws an error if a request did not succeed
}

resp <- sw_api("/people/1")
print(rep)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> function (x, ...)  .Primitive("rep")
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print(rawToChar(resp$content))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] "{\"name\":\"Luke Skywalker\",\"height\":\"172\",\"mass\":\"77\",\"hair_color\":\"blond\",\"skin_color\":\"fair\",\"eye_color\":\"blue\",\"birth_year\":\"19BBY\",\"gender\":\"male\",\"homeworld\":\"https://swapi.dev/api/planets/1/\",\"films\":[\"https://swapi.dev/api/films/1/\",\"https://swapi.dev/api/films/2/\",\"https://swapi.dev/api/films/3/\",\"https://swapi.dev/api/films/6/\"],\"species\":[],\"vehicles\":[\"https://swapi.dev/api/vehicles/14/\",\"https://swapi.dev/api/vehicles/30/\"],\"starships\":[\"https://swapi.dev/api/starships/12/\",\"https://swapi.dev/api/starships/22/\"],\"created\":\"2014-12-09T13:50:51.644000Z\",\"edited\":\"2014-12-20T21:17:56.891000Z\",\"url\":\"https://swapi.dev/api/people/1/\"}"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print(fromJSON(rawToChar(resp$content)))
```

A .Renviron file was created in the home folder of the project, containing the token, password and userid. It can be accessed via `Sys.getenv('TOKEN')`


::: {.cell hash='02_data_acquisition_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_99ad6d7f5858aa28887c16b31838b851'}

```{.r .cell-code}
print(Sys.getenv('TOKEN'))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] "my_individual_token"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
response <- GET(glue("https://www.alphavantage.co/query?function=GLOBAL_QUOTE&symbol=WDI.DE&apikey={Sys.getenv('TOKEN')}"))
print(response)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> Response [https://www.alphavantage.co/query?function=GLOBAL_QUOTE&symbol=WDI.DE&apikey=my_individual_token]
```

# Web Scraping

Web scraping is for getting data from the internet if there is no open API for usage.

rvest is the library which is going to be used. ##Example:


::: {.cell hash='02_data_acquisition_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_aea5f54a768da6adf4fe595cf6f5102e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(rvest)
library(stringr)

# get the URL for the wikipedia page with all S&P 500 symbols
url <- "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_S%26P_500_companies"
# use that URL to scrape the S&P 500 table using rvest
library(rvest)
sp_500 <- url %>%
  # read the HTML from the webpage
  read_html() %>%
  # Get the nodes with the id
  html_nodes(css = "#constituents") %>%
  # html_nodes(xpath = "//*[@id='constituents']"") %>% 
  # Extract the table and turn the list into a tibble
  html_table() %>% 
  .[[1]] %>% 
  as_tibble()
print(sp_500)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> # A tibble: 503 x 8
#>    Symbol Security      `GICS Sector` `GICS Sub-Industry` Headquarters Locatio~1
#>    <chr>  <chr>         <chr>         <chr>               <chr>                 
#>  1 MMM    3M            Industrials   Industrial Conglom~ Saint Paul, Minnesota 
#>  2 AOS    A. O. Smith   Industrials   Building Products   Milwaukee, Wisconsin  
#>  3 ABT    Abbott        Health Care   Health Care Equipm~ North Chicago, Illino~
#>  4 ABBV   AbbVie        Health Care   Pharmaceuticals     North Chicago, Illino~
#>  5 ACN    Accenture     Information ~ IT Consulting & Ot~ Dublin, Ireland       
#>  6 ATVI   Activision B~ Communicatio~ Interactive Home E~ Santa Monica, Califor~
#>  7 ADM    ADM           Consumer Sta~ Agricultural Produ~ Chicago, Illinois     
#>  8 ADBE   Adobe Inc.    Information ~ Application Softwa~ San Jose, California  
#>  9 ADP    ADP           Industrials   Human Resource & E~ Roseland, New Jersey  
#> 10 AAP    Advance Auto~ Consumer Dis~ Automotive Retail   Raleigh, North Caroli~
#> # i 493 more rows
#> # i abbreviated name: 1: `Headquarters Location`
#> # i 3 more variables: `Date added` <chr>, CIK <int>, Founded <chr>
```
:::
:::


## And another example with the imdb movie database


::: {.cell hash='02_data_acquisition_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_0852995237733c6ce14f5c7bea6be61e'}

```{.r .cell-code}
url  <- "https://www.imdb.com/chart/top/?ref_=nv_mv_250"
html <- url %>% 
  read_html()

rank <-  html %>% 
  html_nodes(css = ".titleColumn") %>% 
  html_text() %>% 
  # Extrag all digits between " " and ".\n" The "\" have to be escaped
  # You can use Look ahead "<=" and Look behind "?=" for this
  stringr::str_extract("(?<= )[0-9]*(?=\\.\\n)")%>% 
  # Make all values numeric
  as.numeric()
title <- html %>% 
  html_nodes(".titleColumn > a") %>% 
  html_text()
year <- html %>% 
  html_nodes(".titleColumn .secondaryInfo") %>%
  html_text() %>% 
  # Extract numbers
  stringr::str_extract(pattern = "[0-9]+") %>% 
  as.numeric()
people <- html %>% 
  html_nodes(".titleColumn > a") %>% 
  html_attr("title")
rating <- html %>% 
  html_nodes(css = ".imdbRating > strong") %>% 
  html_text() %>% 
  as.numeric()
num_ratings <- html %>% 
  html_nodes(css = ".imdbRating > strong") %>% 
  html_attr('title') %>% 
  # Extract the numbers and remove the comma to make it numeric values
  stringr::str_extract("(?<=based on ).*(?=\ user ratings)" ) %>% 
  stringr::str_replace_all(pattern = ",", replacement = "") %>% 
  as.numeric()
imdb_tbl <- tibble(rank, title, year, people, rating, num_ratings)
print(imdb_tbl)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> # A tibble: 250 x 6
#>     rank title                                    year people rating num_ratings
#>    <dbl> <chr>                                   <dbl> <chr>   <dbl>       <dbl>
#>  1     1 Die Verurteilten                         1994 Frank~    9.2     2732526
#>  2     2 Der Pate                                 1972 Franc~    9.2     1899988
#>  3     3 The Dark Knight                          2008 Chris~    9       2705719
#>  4     4 Der Pate 2                               1974 Franc~    9       1295423
#>  5     5 Die zwölf Geschworenen                   1957 Sidne~    9        808554
#>  6     6 Schindlers Liste                         1993 Steve~    8.9     1379651
#>  7     7 Der Herr der Ringe: Die Rückkehr des K~  2003 Peter~    8.9     1879735
#>  8     8 Pulp Fiction                             1994 Quent~    8.8     2099767
#>  9     9 Der Herr der Ringe: Die Gefährten        2001 Peter~    8.8     1908686
#> 10    10 Zwei glorreiche Halunken                 1966 Sergi~    8.8      774414
#> # i 240 more rows
```
:::
:::


## Functional Programming

```         
for (variable in vector) {
    
}
# Example: For Loop
numbers <- c(1:5)
for (i in numbers) {
   print(i)
}
```

would be written as

```         
numbers_list <- map(numbers, print)
```
### Example


::: {.cell hash='02_data_acquisition_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_191bb49b7f61eb2c847f92c8191aa4fb'}

```{.r .cell-code}
bike_data_lst <- fromJSON("../../00_data/bike_data.json")
bike_data_lst %>%
  purrr::pluck("productDetail", "variationAttributes", "values", 1, "displayValue") %>%
  print()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] "Stealth"     "aero silver"
```
:::
:::
